segment.source: Delegate Domain-Level Access to the Archive
segment.target: Delegate Domain-Level Access to the Archive

segment.source: Delegate Domain-Level Access to the Archive
segment.target: Delegate Domain-Level Access to the Archive

segment.source: Delegate Domain-Level Access to the Archive
segment.target: Delegate Domain-Level Access to the Archive

segment.source: Set up delegation for your environment so that Group Policy administrators have the appropriate access to and control over Group Policy Objects (GPOs) in the archive.
segment.target: Set up delegation for your environment so that Group Policy administrators have the appropriate access to and control over Group Policy Objects (GPOs) in the archive.

segment.source: There are baseline permissions you can apply to make operation more efficient.
segment.target: There are baseline permissions you can apply to make operation more efficient.

segment.source: You can grant permissions in any manner that meets the needs of your organization.
segment.target: You can grant permissions in any manner that meets the needs of your organization.

segment.source: A user account with the AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account with the AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: To delegate access so that users and groups have appropriate permissions to all GPOs throughout a domain
segment.target: To delegate access so that users and groups have appropriate permissions to all GPOs throughout a domain

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.

segment.source: Click the Domain Delegation tab, and configure access to all GPOs in the domain:
segment.target: Click the Domain Delegation tab, and configure access to all GPOs in the domain:

segment.source: To add access for a user or group, click the Add button, select the user or group, and click OK.
segment.target: To add access for a user or group, click the Add button, select the user or group, and click OK.

segment.source: In the Add Group or User dialog box, select a role and click OK.
segment.target: In the Add Group or User dialog box, select a role and click OK.

segment.source: To remove access for a user or group, select the user or group, and click the Remove button.
segment.target: To remove access for a user or group, select the user or group, and click the Remove button.

segment.source: To modify the roles and permissions delegated to a user or group, select click the Advanced button.
segment.target: To modify the roles and permissions delegated to a user or group, select click the Advanced button.

segment.source: In the Permissions dialog box, select the user or group, select the check box for each role to be assigned to that user or group, and then click OK.
segment.target: In the Permissions dialog box, select the user or group, select the check box for each role to be assigned to that user or group, and then click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Editor and Approver include Reviewer permissions.
segment.target: Editor and Approver include Reviewer permissions.

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: By default, you must be an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.
segment.target: By default, you must be an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.

segment.source: Specifically, you must have Modify Security permission for the domain.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have Modify Security permission for the domain.

segment.source: To delegate read access to Group Policy administrators who use AGPM, you must grant them List Contents as well as Read Settings permissions.
segment.target: To delegate read access to Group Policy administrators who use AGPM, you must grant them List Contents as well as Read Settings permissions.

segment.source: This enables them to view GPOs on the Contents tab of AGPM.
segment.target: This enables them to view GPOs on the Contents tab of AGPM.

segment.source: Other permissions must be explicitly delegated.
segment.target: Other permissions must be explicitly delegated.

segment.source: Editors must be granted Read permission for the deployed copy of a GPO to make full use of Group Policy Software Installation.
segment.target: Editors must be granted Read permission for the deployed copy of a GPO to make full use of Group Policy Software Installation.

segment.source: Membership in the Group Policy Creator Owners group should be restricted, so it is not used to circumvent AGPM management of access to GPOs.
segment.target: Membership in the Group Policy Creator Owners group should be restricted, so it is not used to circumvent AGPM management of access to GPOs.

segment.source: (In the Group Policy Management Console, click Group Policy Objects in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs, click Delegation, and then configure the settings to meet the needs of your organization.)
segment.target: (In the Group Policy Management Console, click Group Policy Objects in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs, click Delegation, and then configure the settings to meet the needs of your organization.)
